intro: Henckelia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Henckelia oppositifolia is often found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas.
